page.title: 12BADMINTON IN RISELEY
page.content: When Riseley Village Hall was built it was designed to incorporate a badminton court. No sooner had building been completed than at least 4 clubs were formed. To date there are 7 clubs, of varying standards, which include Ladies Doubles and Mixed Doubles Clubs. Three of the clubs have teams competing in the Rushden and District League with varying degrees of success. Playing members come mainly from Riseley and a few from neighbouring villages. Each club consists of roughly 20 members and several people play for more than one club. Badminton is played on 4 days of the week during both mornings and evenings. It is felt that without the fees from the clubs the Village Hall would not be able to run as efficiently as it does.
